11.text:
Hello, I'm Jonny and today's story is a chilly
one. It involves an ice-cold Queen and the

17.text:
struggle between good and evil. It's a famous
fairy tale that you might find familiar.

24.text:
The story begins a long time ago. There's
a wicked goblin who has a magic mirror - but

29.text:
not one you would want for everything that
is good and beautiful reflects back as bad

35.text:
and ugly. Then one day the mirror breaks and
the shattered pieces of glass fall onto a

40.text:
small village where two friends Kay and Gerda
live.

45.text:
They are young and happy and always stick
up for each other even when one of them is

49.text:
in trouble. They love playing outside but
unfortunately that means Kay gets hit by some

55.text:
of the falling pieces of mirror - one bit
sticks in his eye and another bit sticks in

60.text:
his heart - and from then on Kay becomes horrible
and nasty and no longer thinks of Gerda as

66.text:
his friend. But she can't understand his strange
behaviour.

71.text:
Then one day, Kay is offered a ride on a huge
sledge. He is a bit nervous, but the driver

76.text:
says stick with me and you'll be fine. Foolishly
he agrees to ride on the sledge across the

82.text:
snowy landscape. The driver of the sledge
transforms himself into a woman wearing a

88.text:
white flowing gown and a crown made of ice
- she is the Snow Queen - and she takes him

98.text:
Gerda is back in the village waiting for Kay,
despite his bad behaviour she still wants

103.text:
to stick by him. When he doesn't return, she
decides to look for him and takes a boat ride down

109.text:
a long river - hoping it will lead to Kay.
Unfortunately, it doesn't. She gets caught

116.text:
by a robber girl with a reindeer. Gerda pours
out her heart with her sad story and the robber

122.text:
girl takes pity on her and admits that she
has seen the Snow Queen heading off to Lapland

133.text:
Could this boy be Kay? - and if so, how will
Gerda find him? Stick with me and find out

139.text:
in the next part of my story soon. Bye for
now.
